caption: Good prices, tasty baos/rice bowls (can't speak for other items), and friendly staff. Cheers.

I was waiting for my evening train to depart and decided to check out Wok n' Bao. I must say that I was pleasantly surprised to have caught up with this place during some down time.  Getting to the point, this is where you need to be if you are craving some nostalgic comfort food. Coming from a true fan of Chinese fried rice I wouldn't mind recommending this spot for the downtown Chicago area.  One piece of advice is to maybe hold the veggies on ya order if your not a fan of full size cut veggies and not the lil chopped pieces you see in pandas rice.  Also that chicken and sauce fye as hell boi, lol! #MarqWasHere
Great food, okay location, amazing service. I wish they were a bit further away from the loop. Their wings are the best!

Can't really get more middle-of-the-ground than this place.  I've eaten here over 10 times now and I can definitely say their wings are their best offering, though they're way too expensive for the portion size.  The Bao are next in line for me, but they're very hit or miss -- for instance, my favorite Bao they offer is the pork belly bao, but at least 1/3 of the time, the taste is off and it's far too salty.  Their "street bowls" are awful, in my opinion.  Every one I've had, no matter which sauce I selected, tasted pretty much the same.  I believe this is in part due to using the same cooking pans with minimal to no cleaning between cooking different bowls.  Every single one had a taste of their Szechuan sauce, which I strongly feel is not a good flavor.  I'm a Louisiana native with Cajun blood who's a HUGE fan of spicy food too, so coming from me, that's saying a lot.  Overall, I would never suggest eating here, but if you choose to, I'd strongly advise sticking to the wings and/or bao.  There are plenty of better options around however, especially with the French Market 1 block away.  Despite saying it's "middle-of-the-road," I'm giving it 2 stars for pricing vs. portion size vs. quality of food; as many other reviews state, the portion sizes definitely don't seem to match the pricing.  I believe that applies to every item on their menu.
good stuff but pricey considering the small portion size

‘Street bowls’.....um yes please.  This spot is in the bottom of my building and it’s second time I’ve been while traveling here for work.  I had soba noodles with tofu and ginger sauce and it was delicious.  Definitely worth a try if I’m the neighborhood.  Should have gotten some kombucha as well.  Next time!  👍🏻👍🏻
Great lunch stop at a reasonable price, well worth a look
I want to like this place, but I just wasnt vibing the sauces. The prices are pretty good though, especially if you get the wings

Hip spot offering Asian inspired stir fry and bao. The baco’s are delish and full of flavor. Stir fry is very flavorful but for such a trendy spot, offering the stir fry in “to-go” boxes underserves the quality and hipness of the rest of the establishment. It can get busy but they have ample seating area. Try the bao, you won’t be dissapointed!
Got the street bowl with the soba noodles and ribeye and it was good! They’re chicken wings are to die for!!
The sauces where a little too salty.

The worst bao I've ever had. I'm surprised people are rating this high. I've tried their bao twice and the first (pork belly) was way too salty. The second time (kung pao chicken and black pepper beef) were not only salty, they were topped with an inedible drizzle. I could not finish either bao.  I give the restaurant two stars for location, ambiance, food esthetics, and staff.  I will give then another shot with their wings...hopefully, I can upgrade my rating.

Nice place. Easy to miss it on the street (although you will probably smell the smoke that is sent to the sidewalk 😡).  Tried the Wings, the Bao and one of the Noodles. Noodles are great (I had the Udon with ribeye and the spicy sauce) and also the Bao (pork belly). The wings (sweet and spicy) are mehh. The atmosphere here is nice too, but can get a bit busy during lunch (better coming before 11:30 or after 12:40).

I wanted this place to be really good because I live a block away.  Tried work-day take-out for lunch with a buddy from work.  We both got the noodles with peanut sauce.  The food was not good.  It was the least peanut-y peanut sauce I've ever had, was massively salty and was downright bad.  The noodles were cooked well, but the dish could have used more veggies to lighten the heavy noodles.  Not going back.

Had the Hong Kong noodles with chicken and their szechuan soy sauce, and I would recommend avoiding that particular combo. Very light on protein and veggies, and the sauce was just a spicy salt bomb. Guess I got my electrolytes for the day at least.
Not bad, kind of small portions for the price. Flavors are pretty good, next time I’ll try the wings.
The service is excellent. The food is even better if that's possible. Great atmosphere! If you are near the train station stop here.

We tried Wok N' Bao for lunch and it was delightful.  The setup is the same as Asadito(Mexican restaurant next door) and I actually like this food more than Asadito. I tried the MSG wings(next time I will ask for them to be cooked for about 1-2 mins longer so they are crisper like I like) and my husband tried the Street Bowl with jasmine rice and chicken.  It was great for him because it did not have egg.  The wait time was minimal and the food was hot and right from the grill.  I will be adding this to the list of restaurants for lunch.

We visited on the 3rd day of operation so couldn't find any reviews. It was a good choice. The food was delicious. They accomodated an unusual request without hesitation. Price was as one might expect, not cheap but then it's a quality meal. We would return on our next trip to Chicago.
